snippet: The head of the United Nations refugee agency said at least 15 nations, including the United States, would help resettle Syrians  fleeing the civil war.
abstract: At least 15 countries, including the United States and many in Europe, have agreed to set up special quotas for fugitives fleeing Syria’s civil war, marking shift in international thinking about how to deal with world’s biggest humanitarian crisis.
lead_paragraph: The head of the United Nations refugee agency said at least 15 nations, including the United States, would help resettle Syrians  fleeing the civil war.

headline.main: Countries Agree to Special Quotas for Syrian Refugees
